title: Is there correlation between race and testosterone? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are differences but they’re not really substantial. There’s also differences in terms of estrogen. Western Africans tend to have higher levels of testosterone but also have the highest levels of estrogen. Hormones are all about the balance between them, too much of one and not enough of the other can lead to reall issues after all it’s hormones that dictate whether you are male or female. They’re seriously powerful things that people do not consciously think about. I’ve seen another answer here state that black men have the highest levels of testosterone and this is what leads them to having deeper voices and a more muscular physique. This is a very basic understanding of the genetics of it all. For one thing grouping all Africans into the category of “black” is a really silly thing to do when discussing genetics it drives me insane just as the term “white” does. The reason that specifically Western African men appear to have more muscular physiques is due to the fact they’re more likely to have higher numbers of fast twitch muscle fibres as opposed to slow twitch. Fast twitch fibres are larger which is what gives the more muscular appearance and they are used for generating power and speed but they also require more oxygen and tire faster. Slow twitch are the muscles used for endurance. It’s why grouping all Africans into “black” is stupid, the difference between those of Eastern African origin and Western African origin is drastic and there’s a reason why the best sprinters in the Olympics typically have a Western African origin and the best endurance athletes have an Eastern African one. The difference in the levels of testosterone between each populations seriously not large enough to bring about such drastic changes in physique and appearance it’s far deeper than that.

In the largest medical studies carried out by scientists and medical professionals, using the largest sample sizes and sophisticated sampling methods conclude that the testosterone levels of white males is slightly, (by no significant amount) fractionaly higher than black males, and Mexican males was slightly higher than white males. The hormonal difference found in large modern safisticated studies is in estrogen levels. Black males showed significantly higher levels of estrogen (the female sex hormone) than both white and Mexican males.
